page.title: 12Lambing time on a croft
page.content: The lambing starts around the middle of April and we go round the sheep to see if they need any help in lambing, and see if the sheep will take the lamb. When the lambs are all born they are marked so we know if they are male or female.Then we shed them and them we wean them. After that we sell some of the male lambs and in the summer time we shear them and in November we dip them so they won't get scabs or ticks. If a lamb dies the crofter finds anoth er lamb for the sheep.He will skin the dead lamb and put the skin on the living new lamb.After a few days the skin is removed and the sheep takes to the lamb as if it were her own lamb.
